name: Fisetin (High-Dose Senolytic)
description: High-dose fisetin protocol (500-2000mg) used intermittently as a senolytic to clear senescent cells. Distinct from daily low-dose use. The "senolytic hit" approach targets zombie cells during 1-3 day bursts, followed by weeks of clearance.
mechanisms: Senolytic â€” kills senescent cells via apoptosis
Bcl-2 family inhibition in senescent cells

dosage.notes: Senolytic dosing is HIGH and INTERMITTENT. Different from daily use. Take with fat (olive oil) for absorption. Mayo Clinic trial used 20mg/kg.

keyFindings: Most potent senolytic identified in natural compound screen (Mayo Clinic)
AFFIRM-LITE trial: high-dose fisetin for senescent cell clearance
Intermittent dosing allows immune clearance of dead senescent cells between rounds
interactions: Blood thinners (high doses may affect platelet function)
